Reviews.Title: Best computer for the money
Reviews.Author: mntnlife
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop for the money. No it does not have a touch screen but if you want a touch screen, I would recommend getting a tablet. I went from Vista to Windows 7 and did not like it so I installed a free program called Classic Shell. It gives you the old look of Vista and XP and this helps to soften the learning curve of the windows 7 and 8.1. It is about the cheapest computer that you can buy and still get a built-in disk drive.

Reviews.Title: Decent Laptop
Reviews.Author: Dovahkiin
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a coworker. He likes it and has not complained about it so far. I suppose it met his requirements. It isn't something I would buy for myself but on his recommendation I'm giving it four stars.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy unless you only need it for facebook and email.
Reviews.Author: Jordon Renn
Reviews.Content: I have the older version of this computer which treated me very well, but this computer isn't powerful at all and runs slow with windows 8 on it. I've only has it for 2-3 months and I am already looking into buying another new computer.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I expected!
Reviews.Author: Stacy Thomas
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my PC. Thanks, I use it every day for business and pleasure! Love it more every day!

Reviews.Title: Description issues
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: I intended to find a laptop with WIndows 7 to avoid the hassles of Windows 8; however, I thought with a touchscreen, Windows 8 might not be too bad. So, in my search I came across this computer with this sentence within the description:"Enjoy the ability to pinch, swipe, rotate or scroll through images on the display screen with a simple brush of your fingers."Due to the wording of this statement I mistakenly assumed this was a touchscreen. It is not. This statement is about the touchpad, not the screen itself.While there is nothing wrong with this laptop per se, I would not have purchased it had the description been more clear that this is not a touchscreen. I would have looked for another laptop either with Windows 7 or a touchscreen.12/8/13: Update: I have had this a few days and am still trying to get all the Windows 8 updates downloaded to get to Windows 8.1 (so far at 96). At this point, I am strongly considering wiping it and loading my old version of Vista.I also just discovered NO HDMI PORT! I can't believe a new laptop would be sold without HDMI!

Reviews.Title: toshiba a brand i trust
Reviews.Author: raven
Reviews.Content: I don't know about u .but I pretty much grew up with this brand . I've learned to trust it.I've had ,tv,home stereos. It's so much to it I  still haven't got to see all its power
